character.name: Urey Rockbell
character.description: Urey Rockbell was the father of http://anidb.net/ch6588 [Winry Rockbell] and the son of http://anidb.net/ch10164 [Pinako Rockbell]. He grew up, lived and worked in Resembool as a surgeon alongside his wife, http://anidb.net/ch16495 [Sara Rockbell]. When the Ishval Civil War reached its peak, the two Doctors Rockbell reluctantly left their family home in Resembool to help treat the wounded on the front lines. Though both Amestrian, the Rockbells were rather well known in the Kanda region of Ishval for treating the injured on either side of the conflict. Though many, including http://anidb.net/ch10165 [Doctors Marcoh] and http://anidb.net/ch14964 [Knox], viewed them as a medical inspiration and several Ishvalan people owe their lives to the husband and wife medical team, officials the Amestrian military began to view their humanitarian effort as a nuisance and sought to have them killed. In the manga, http://anidb.net/ch14594 [Solf J. Kimblee] is unofficially ordered to kill them and stage their deaths as an accident so that the military would not be forced to waste resources ensuring their protection as humanitarians of their nation, but before the Red Lotus Alchemist could arrive on the scene, the Rockbells are killed by http://anidb.net/ch6593 [Scar], who had just awakened in their makeshift medical centre and was driven into a violent rage upon learning that his brother was dead. In the 2003 anime series, the Rockbells are officially ordered executed as insurgents because their Ishvalan patients would return to the battlefield after treatment. http://anidb.net/ch6586 [Roy Mustang] is ordered to carry out the execution against his will.

character.name: Sara Rockbell
character.description: Sara Rockbell was a surgeon and the mother of http://anidb.net/ch6588 [Winry Rockbell]. She married into the Rockbell family by wedding http://anidb.net/ch16494 [Urey Rockbell], http://anidb.net/ch10164 [Pinako Rockbell]`s son and practiced medicine alongside her husband. When the Ishval Civil War reached its peak, the two Doctors Rockbell reluctantly left their family home in Resembool to help treat the wounded on the front lines. Though both Amestrian, the Rockbells were rather well known in the Kanda region of Ishval for treating the injured on either side of the conflict. Though many, including Doctors http://anidb.net/ch10165 [Marcoh] and http://anidb.net/ch14964 [Knox], viewed them as a medical inspiration and several Ishvalan people owe their lives to the husband and wife medical team, officials the Amestrian military began to view their humanitarian effort as a nuisance and sought to have them killed. In the manga, http://anidb.net/ch14594 [Solf J. Kimblee] is unofficially ordered to kill them and stage their deaths as an accident so that the military would not be forced to waste resources ensuring their protection as humanitarians of their nation, but before the Red Lotus Alchemist could arrive on the scene, the Rockbells are killed by http://anidb.net/ch6593 [Scar], who had just awakened in their makeshift medical center and was driven into a violent rage upon learning that his brother was dead. In the 2003 anime series, the Rockbells are officially ordered executed as insurgents because their Ishvalan patients would return to the battlefield after treatment. http://anidb.net/ch6586 [Roy Mustang] is ordered to carry out the execution against his will. Sara was a rather tenacious woman, refusing to leave Ishval with the other Amestrian civilians when given the option by her husband. She gives the excuse that Winry and Pinako would never forgive her if she abandoned her calling and reminds Urey that Rockbell women are strong (though she is only a Rockbell by marriage).

character.name: Scar no Ani
character.description: Scar`s brother is a minor character in the Fullmetal Alchemist franchise, and appears in the manga version and both anime versions of the story. He is responsible for saving his brother`s life during the war in Ishval, sacrificing himself and giving away his right arm, which later allows http://anidb.net/ch6593 [Scar] to kill state alchemists. He is never seen in the present time as he died during the Ishval Massacre, but he is seen in several flashbacks. Like his brother, his name has never been revealed.

character.name: Dominic LeCoulte
character.description: Dominic is a gruff, anti-social old automail engineer who lives in the mountains on the outskirts of Rush Valley. Having spotted the young http://anidb.net/ch14968 [Paninya] after the accident that left her unable to move on her own, Dominic took her with him and created high quality automail limbs for her to use (under the pretense that her lifeless, self-pity annoyed him). Though decidedly mean on the outside, Dominic occasionally shows that he is a kind person with a loving heart and a great passion for automail. Prodigiously skilled in his craft, Dominic has stated that it is his dream to internalize sophisticated weaponry such as carbines in automail limbs without sacrificing their standard shape and size. As such, he has fitted Paninya`s right leg with a hidden shin blade and her right with a 1.5 inch carbine. Though well known, he has no interest in taking on apprentices and repeatedly turns http://anidb.net/ch6588 [Winry Rockbell] down for the position when she asks, but refers her to Atelier Garfiel in Rush Valley. Additionally, he seems to have had a rather traumatic history with http://anidb.net/ch10164 [Pinako Rockbell], trembling in horror at the mere mention of her name and referring to her as "The Pantheress of Resembool".

character.name: Garfiel
character.description: Garfiel is a skilled automail engineer and the proprietor of Atelier Garfiel in the town of Rush Valley. When http://anidb.net/ch6588 [Winry Rockbell] is referred to him by http://anidb.net/ch16497 [Dominic], Garfiel is only too happy to accept the cute young girl as his live-in apprentice and joins the rest of the Rush Valley community in treating her like a beloved family member. Garfiel is rather effeminate and appears to prefer the company of men, which results in his acting largely as a source of comic relief in scenes that involve him.

character.name: Bradley-fujin
character.description: Mrs. Bradley is the wife of the Führer, http://anidb.net/ch10175 [King Bradley]. A kind and trusting wife, she has no idea that her devoted husband is inhuman and remains blissfully ignorant of the homunculi`s existence and dastardly plans. Though she rarely appears in either series, usually accompanying http://anidb.net/ch14960 [Selim], Mrs. Bradley`s appearances usually fall under the category of comic relief as she speaks jovially of her familial life and romantic past with the Führer. Mrs. Bradley is later on kidnapped by http://anidb.net/ch6586 [Roy Mustang] under the cover of the night. Though he has no intentions of harming her, Mustang hopes to use the Fuhrer`s wife as a sort of shield against Central`s forces in his uprising against the city. When direct orders from Brigadier General Clemin call for everyone but Mustang to be killed -- including Mrs. Bradley, she begins to truly question her husband`s emotions towards her and her entire life. Under the pretense that it was the government itself which had betrayed the Bradley family, Mrs. Bradley is taken to a local radio station by http://anidb.net/ch10166 [Maria Ross], http://anidb.net/ch14596 [Kain Fuery] and http://anidb.net/ch14598 [Heymans Breda], where she makes it clear there had been an attempt made against her life to a nationwide audience. She is eventually told that her husband had been in a fatal train explosion, making her almost faint from the shock.

character.name: Henschel
character.description: Second Lieutenant Henschel is an Amestrian State Military Officer stationed at Fort Briggs and one of http://anidb.net/ch13409 [Major General Olivier Mira Armstrong]`s loyal subordinates. After the inadvertent attack on Briggs by the Homunculus http://anidb.net/ch13408 [Sloth], Henschel opposes the sealing of the tunnel`s opening proposed by http://anidb.net/ch14961 [Lt. General Raven] because he fears for the soldiers who had been sent in to examine the channel. Though the Major General initially appears to ignore Henschel`s protests, she reveals to him in secret that http://anidb.net/ch5885 [Edward Elric] had alchemically created a second entrance behind Raven`s back. Along with http://anidb.net/ch13410 [Captain Buccaneer] and a few others, 2nd Lt. Henschel enters the tunnel and is overjoyed to find a pair of survivors despite the apparent carnage caused by the Homunculus Pride. After Major General Armstrong is transferred to Central Command, Henschel discusses the coming change of regime with Buccaneer and the two agree that Central`s impending flunkies have no idea what to expect from Briggs` soldiers. When an armada of Briggs soldiers are smuggled into Central City through the Armstrong Family mansion, 2nd Lt. Henschel is among them and participates valiantly in the coup d`etat on The Promised Day.

character.name: Storch
character.description: Storch is an Amestrian State Military Officer stationed in Central City and the personal secretary of the Führer, http://anidb.net/ch10175 [King Bradley], until http://anidb.net/ch6587 [Lt. Riza Hawkeye] is given the position so as to allow Bradley to keep an eye on her and the other members of http://anidb.net/ch6586 [Colonel Mustang]`s team. He arrives outside Central Command to deliver Hawkeye`s new orders personally and is accompanied by Yakovlev from Internal Affairs. Storch reappears in Chapter 98, arriving outside Central Command upon hearing that Bradley has returned from his mysterious absence and directing the cadre of Central troops waiting for orders from their Führer. As Storch orders the soldiers into the compound and attempts to establish contact with any loyal soldiers within the fortress, his platoon is incapacitated and he is knocked unconscious by http://anidb.net/ch10405 [Fuu].

character.name: Yakovlev
character.description: Yakovlev is an Amestrian State Military Officer from the Internal Affairs office at Central Command in Central City. Along with Storch, he approaches http://anidb.net/ch6587 [Riza Hawkeye] with transfer orders from the top, reassigning her to the post of http://anidb.net/ch10175 [Führer]`s personal secretary. Like all military offices in the series, Yakovlev is named for a type of real world military vehicle, in this case the Russian military planes built by the Yakovlev aircraft company.

character.name: Fessler
character.description: Brigadier General Fessler was the Amestrian military officer put in charge of securing the Kanda region of Ishval during the Ishval Civil War. A petty and ignorant man, Fessler was more concerned with enhancing his reputation than with the lives of his subordinates and, in his obsession with clearing out his region before the other officers, made a number of hasty decisions which cost many soldiers` lives. When Major http://anidb.net/ch6589 [Alex Louis Armstrong] had his mental breakdown from the emotional strain of massacring Ishvalan civilians, Fessler made it worse by berating him and even when his mistakes were devastating to his own troops, he referred to them as "home runs" so long as the mission objective was reached. When Colonel http://anidb.net/ch10893 [Basque Grand] escorted Logue Lowe to Fessler with the hopes of gaining an audience with http://anidb.net/ch10175 [King Bradley], Fessler stubbornly refused and ordered all his soldiers to return to the fray, at which point he was shot point-blank in the chest by Grand`s rifle. Though there were several witnesses to the blatant assassination, all the soldiers present agreed that Fessler`s death had been caused by a stray bullet, truly signifying how much they hated him and his methods. Fessler`s post as commander of Kanda was succeeded by Basque Grand.

character.name: Chris Mustang
character.description: Madame Christmas is the proprietor of a hostess bar in Central City frequently patronaged by http://anidb.net/ch6586 [Colonel Roy Mustang]. At first, it would merely seem that this bar is further proof of Mustang`s unapologetic debauchery, but it becomes quite apparent that the women under Madame Christmas` care act as secret informants to Mustang and his squad and that Madame Christmas herself is a skilled intelligencer and contact between Roy and http://anidb.net/ch14966 [Lt. General Grumman] in East City. A rather gruff woman, Madame Christmas is frequently sharp with Roy. It has been recently revealed by a secret investigation into Roy`s past carried out by Central Command`s agents that Madame Christmas` real name is Chris Mustang and that she is Roy`s foster mother. Well aware of Roy`s ambitions as well as the clandestine goings-on of his enemies, Madame Christmas expects great things of her little boy. In Character Guidebook 3 released recently in Japan it`s revealed Chris Mustang is actually the younger sister to Roy`s biological father, making her his aunt. According to this guide, she took Roy in after the death of both his parents, when Roy was still very young.

character.name: Bobby
character.description: Bobby is one of the skilled engineers who maintain the vital Fort Briggs in working order under the command of http://anidb.net/ch13409 [Major General Armstrong]. When some of the other engineer begin to hear strange sounds in the large pipelines on the lowest level of the fort, Bobby is called to offer his expert opinion and correctly deduces that the sounds are not coming from within the pipes but from beneath the fort`s foundation. He narrowly escapes danger when the Homunculus http://anidb.net/ch13408 [Sloth] bursts from the ground.

character.name: Kinba Isha
character.description: Gold-Toothed Doctor is an old man who is in possession of his very own Philosopher`s Stone, as well as one of the few responsible for Wrath`s creation. He is privy to Amestris` top secrets and carries out Father`s orders in a ruthless fashion. The Doctor is a short old man who has one golden tooth, short auburn hair, and moustache. He can normally be seen wearing a white lab coat along with his signature glasses. In numerous occasions, his eyes have also been shown to be disturbingly unfocused.

character.name: Dolcetto
character.description: One of Greeds henchmen. He is a chimera made of a human and a dog. He is very loyal to his master and even attacks King Bradley to defend Greed knowing he has no chance of winning (2009 anime).

character.description: http://anidb.net/ch7783 [Van Hohenheim], before he became immortal. As a slave, he didn`t have a name, but was referred to as Slave Number 23. Thanks to his blood, certain http://anidb.net/t2027 [homunculus] was created that gave knowledge to him and others around him.

character.name: Giolio Comanche
character.description: Giolio Comanche, better known as the Silver Alchemist (銀の錬金術師, Shirogane no Renkinjutsushi), is an elderly, diminutive man whose thirst for battle is belied by his grandfatherly countenance. The Silver Alchemist is one of the State Alchemists sent into the Ishval Civil War as part of Order 3066. Notably, Comanche is the only one among them shown smiling when the Order goes into effect. He loses his left leg during the war, resulting in his current peg leg. This does not slow him down, as he has adopted this peg leg to his combat style.
